titles.title: Waiving certain points of order against the bill (H.R. 4603) making appropriations for the Departments of Commerce, Justice, and State, the Judiciary, and related agencies programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1995, and making supplemental appropriations for these departments and agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1994, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-556, by Mr. Beilenson.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4603. Specified points of order against the bill shall be waived. Where points of order are waived against only part of a paragraph, any point of order against matter in the balance of the paragraph may be applied only within the balance of the paragraph and not against the entire paragraph. Bill is open to amendments. The amendment printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution shall have precedence over a motion that the Committee of the Whole rise and report the bill to the House, if the amendment is offered by a Member designated in the report.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 176.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 243 - 177 (Roll no. 273).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/22/1994--Introduced. Waives points of order against the consideration of H.R. 4603 (making appropriations for the Departments of Commerce, Justice, and State, the Judiciary, and related agencies for FY 1995 and supplemental appropriations for such entities for FY 1994).
